Grammaticos Courselist
Course Name
Summary Information
University Reading

Intended for Advanced Grades: 11/12 as well as University Freshmen/First Year. This course examines the Canon [Great Literary Works] featured across Ivy League and Top Universities in the US, Canada, and the UK.
Advanced Reading I
Close Reading Tactics: how to increase Reading Comprehension. A detailed exploration of 10 Literary Masterpieces. Part One.
Advanced Reading II
Close Reading Tactics: how to increase Reading Comprehension. A detailed exploration of 10 Literary Masterpieces. Part Two.
Advanced Reading III
Close Reading Tactics: how to increase Reading Comprehension. A detailed exploration of 10 Literary Masterpieces. Part Three.
Fundamentals of Reading I (6-7)
Building Reading Habits: Foundations of Reading. It examines reading techniques through 10 books. Part One
Fundamentals of Reading I (8-9)
Foundations of Close Reading: Exploration of 10 books, 500 new literary vocabulary per term.
Fundamentals of Reading I (10-12)
Foundations of Close Reading: Exploration of 12 Literary Masterpieces, 600 new literary vocabulary per term.
Fundamentals of Reading II (6-7)
Building Reading Habits: Foundations of Reading. It builds on Part One. 10 books, 700 new literary words. Full, year-long.
Fundamentals of Reading II (8-9)
Continuation of Part One. In-depth analysis of Close Reading. 10 books, 1000 new literary words. Full, year-long.
Fundamentals of Reading II (10-12)
Continuation of Part One. In-depth analysis of Close Reading. 15 books, 1500 new literary words. Full, year-long.
Advanced Writing I (11, 12, pre- college)
The Fundamental Components of Writing: Technical Writing, Thesis Statement and Body Paragraph compilations; Syntax, Word usage, and how to reference. Part One.
Advanced Writing II ((11, 12, pre- college)
The Fundamental Components of Writing: Technical Writing, Thesis Statement and Body Paragraph compilations; Syntax, Word usage, and how to reference. 10-page paper. Part Two. 800 new vocabulary.
Advanced Writing III ((11, 12, pre- college)
Private 1:1. Practice the Fundamentals of Writing. compile 1-page, 5-page, 10-page, and a term paper of 20 pages. 1200 new vocabulary.
Fundamentals of Writing I (6-7)
Fundamentals of Writing: Language in context. How to craft a sentence, Grammar, Syntax (word order), and Vocabulary usage.
Fundamentals of Writing I (8-9)
Fundamentals of Writing: Language in Context. How to craft a Thesis Statement, Body Paragraph, and full length paper.  Explore Styles of Writing: Fiction & Nonfiction.
Fundamentals of Writing I (10-12)
Fundamentals of Writing: Language in Context. How to craft a Thesis Statement, Body Paragraph, and full length paper.  Explore Styles of Writing: Fiction & Nonfiction.
Fundamentals of Writing II (6-7)
Fundamentals of Writing: Language in context. How to craft a paragraph and a full length paper; Grammar, Syntax (word order), and Vocabulary usage. 500 new vocabulary. Part Two.
Fundamentals of Writing II (8-9)
Fundamentals of Writing: Language in Context. How to craft a Research Paper, Creative Writing, Technical Writing Concepts in Practice. 600 new vocabulary. Part Two.
Fundamentals of Writing II (10-12)
The Mechanics of Writing. How to edit effectively. Economy of Language. Syntax and Morphology. 3 full length 10-pagers. 1000 new vocabulary.
Technical Writing I
*Only for advanced Grade 11, Grade 12, and University Freshmen. How to craft an effective argument. Persuasive writing components, research paper techniques. Part One. 1000 new vocabulary.
Technical Writing II
*Only for advanced Grade 11, Grade 12, and University Freshmen. How to craft an effective argument in writing. 6 full length.  10-page papers. 1600 new vocabulary.
AP European History
European History: a through survey of the course per the specifications of the College Board, fully equipped with mock tests and weekly quizzes.
AP Language
A careful examination of Language as per the specifications of the College Board, fully equipped with mock tests and weekly quizzes.
AP Literature
A detailed review and exploration of literary concepts etc., as per the specifications of the College Board, fully equipped with mock tests and weekly quizzes.
AP Art History
Fully equipped with weekly quizzes and all necessary mocks to succeed on the test. It is created and taught as per the specifications of the College Board.
AP World History
A detailed examination of the subject mater in accordance with the specifications of the College Board. Mock tests included.
Poetry - 19th century

In this special course, we will survey a number of English and American authors of the 19th century, discuss in detail the mechanics of poetic analyses, and guide the students’ understanding of verse.
Poetry - 20th century

In this special course, we will survey a number of English and American authors of the 20th century, discuss in detail the mechanics of poetic analyses, and guide the students’ understanding of verse.
Poetry - Middle Ages and the Renaissance
This is a most important time frame as it is foundational to later literary contributions. It will allow the students to understand medieval verse within a socio-historical context.
Dante
A close examination of Dante’s oeuvre. A big focus will be placed on Inferno within the Divine Comedy. Portions of La Vita Nova will be covered as well.
Shakespeare
A survey course focusing on a sampling of 5 comedies, 5 tragedies, and sonnets.
Petrarca
A survey of Petrarca’s Songbook (Canzoniere). This is an important course as it will link this author’s literary contributions to both Dante and Boccaccio.
Boccaccio
A close examination of Boccaccio’s Decameron.
Marlow
A close examination of Marlow’s work. A specific focus is to be placed on: Doctor Faustus, The Massacre at Paris, Dido, Queen of Carthage, and The Jew of Malta.
Jane Austen
Love, Marriage, Family, and Womanhood. The Language of Jane Austen through 7 of her novels.
Charles Dickens
A sampling of 6 Dickensian novels. This will be a thematic analysis of the author’s oeuvre. Victorian England and ‘the art of the novel.’
Bronte Sisters
The work of all three Bronte sisters will be examined through the lens of their respective literary contributions. Victorian England. Women and authorial intent.
Oscar Wilde
A Wilde-centric exploration of Victorian England. Societal norms, convention, propriety, and candour in English society. A close examination of Wilde’s works.
Goethe
Faust. The whole course will focus on a careful exploration of this seminar work of literature and its many ramifications in world literatures.
Lessing & Schiller
A survey of 15th century literature and philosophy through the lens of German authors. Lessing and Schiller. Plays, articles, and verse.
20th century Canon - English Literature
Through our Canon series, we will cover a total of 100 titles ranging from the Middle Ages to the 21st century. Each Canon course will feature 5 specific titles which the students read closely.
20th century Canon - American Literature
Through our Canon series, we will cover a total of 100 titles ranging from the Middle Ages to the 21st century. Each Canon course will feature 5 specific titles which the students read closely.
20th century - Italian literature
Through our Canon series, we will cover a total of 100 titles ranging from the Middle Ages to the 21st century. Italian edition. In English Translation.
20th century - Spanish Literature
Through our Canon series, we will cover a total of 100 titles ranging from the Middle Ages to the 21st century. Spanish edition. In English Translation.
20th century - French Literature
Through our Canon series, we will cover a total of 100 titles ranging from the Middle Ages to the 21st century. French edition. In English Translation.
20th Centry - Diaspora
Through our Canon series, we will cover a total of 100 titles ranging from the Middle Ages to the 21st century. Diaspora: South Africa, Australia, Asia, and Africa.
21st century - the New Novel - US
A close examination of six 21st century US novels. An exploration of Literary Theory.
Campus Novel
Literary Theory through Literary Titles. Novels depicting ‘campus life.’
Depictions of Women in Cont. Literature
A depiction of women in contemporary literature across English and American titles.
Environmentalism through Literature
How does contemporary literature capture the notion of environmentalism? Is it didactic? Weaving of fiction with nonfiction.
Coming of Age - English & US
An analysis of 6 coming-of-age Literary Titles across the US and England.
Coming of Age - European & Diaspora
An analysis of 6 coming-of-age Literary Titles across Europe and the Diaspora.

Applications to University

Planning

Parental support with Parent/Teacher mtgs
Many parents benefit from additional support navigating their child’s educational life. We support them closely and provide expert mentorship and guidance.
Support with email writing and documentation

Expressing oneself professionally and with clarity is difficult. We support our clients with all of their writing needs from the compilation of an email, letter, etc., to getting ready for interviews.
Support with translation into English
Translation is an art. We support an array of translation needs our clients may have across 6 languages!
